episodes.title: The Serfsons
episodes.plot: In a medieval world, Lisa is forced to use illegal magic when Marge's mother is turned into an Ice Walker.

episodes.title: Springfield Splendor
episodes.plot: Lisa's sad experience is adapted into a graphic novel, which becomes a Broadway show.

episodes.title: Whistler's Father
episodes.plot: Homer launches Maggie's baby-celebrity career with her whistling talent; Marge is hired to style Fat Tony's brothel.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXVIII
episodes.plot: Maggie gets possessed by a demon; Lisa discovers a creepy/perfect version of her family in an alternative universe; Homer cannibalizes himself.

episodes.title: Grampy Can Ya Hear Me
episodes.plot: Grampa gets a hearing aid and finally hears what everyone has been saying about him.

episodes.title: The Old Blue Mayor She Ain't What She Used To Be
episodes.plot: Marge runs for mayor and uses Homer as the butt of her jokes to gain public support.

episodes.title: Singin' in the Lane
episodes.plot: Homer gets his old bowling team back together and they wind up competing with arrogant millionaires.

episodes.title: Mr. Lisa's Opus
episodes.plot: In the future, Lisa writes a college application essay to Harvard and recalls disappointing past birthdays that helped shape her.

episodes.title: Gone Boy
episodes.plot: When Bart goes missing, the town puts together a search party to find him.

episodes.title: Haw-Haw Land
episodes.plot: Lisa falls for a crooning jazz pianist named Brendan; Bart discovers he has an affinity for chemistry.

episodes.title: Frink Gets Testy
episodes.plot: Mr. Burns builds a doomsday ark after he believes the world is ending; Professor Frink is tasked with determining who is worth saving.

episodes.title: Homer is Where the Art Isn't
episodes.plot: Homer is accused of stealing a multimillion-dollar painting and only freelance insurance investigator Manacek can prove his innocence or guilt.

episodes.title: 3 Scenes Plus a Tag from a Marriage
episodes.plot: Homer and Marge tell the story of how they went from loving life without kids to being miserable parents.

episodes.title: Fears of a Clown
episodes.plot: Bart goes to prankster rehab after a clown-mask prank terrifies the town and ruins Krusty's career causing him to give up comedy and try serious drama.

episodes.title: No Good Read Goes Unpunished
episodes.plot: Marge forces everyone to give up their electronics and go to the book store in an effort to bring the family together.

episodes.title: King Leer
episodes.plot: Homer and Marge attempt to reunite Moe with his troubled family.

episodes.title: Lisa Gets the Blues
episodes.plot: The Simpsons' flight to Gainesville gets re-routed to New Orleans, where Lisa must regain her confidence as a jazz musician.

episodes.title: Forgive and Regret
episodes.plot: On his deathbed, Grampa makes a confession to Homer about the notes from Homer's mother that got lost when she left. This angers Homer to the point of refusing to reconcile with Abe after he miraculously recovers.

episodes.title: Left Behind
episodes.plot: Homer gets Flanders a job at the power plant; Marge feels there's no spark left in their marriage.

episodes.title: Throw Grampa from the Dane
episodes.plot: The Simpsons go to Denmark so Grampa can benefit from its free health-care system.

episodes.title: Flanders' Ladder
episodes.plot: When Bart falls into a coma after he is struck by lightning, he is visited by ghosts seeking closure.
